annotations.description: It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has been more to see on the pitch than in most of the other games. Neither of the teams had any obvious superiority in this game. The strategy of the home side was to control the pace of the match with possession style football. Whereas the strategy of the away side was a bit risky and reliant on solid defending to dispossess the opponent and break fast.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: That's it for today, Anthony Taylor has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Chelsea are just stroking the ball across the park now, but the defence is doing very well breaking up their possession.
One of the defenders reacts at the last minute to brilliantly block a pass from Willian (Chelsea).
The linesman raises his flag as one of the players from West Brom was in an offside position.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Chris Brunt (West Brom) quickly takes the corner kick with a short pass.
Craig Dawson (West Brom) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him. West Brom will take a corner kick.

annotations.label: time
annotations.description: There will be a minimum of 5 min. of added time.
West Brom are bossing possession at the moment by exchanging some precise passes from player to player.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The resulting corner from Stephane Sessegnon (West Brom) is cleared.
Saido Berahino (West Brom) fails to send a pass into the box as his effort is cut out. The ball is out of play and West Brom manage to earn a corner.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: James McClean (West Brom) doesn't hesitate to lash home from just outside the box. He hits the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and it nestles in the net.
Stephane Sessegnon (West Brom) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea) for a tough tackle.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Craig Gardner (West Brom) swings in a cross from the corner, but Thibaut Courtois reads it well and gathers the ball.
Stephane Sessegnon (West Brom) whips the ball in, but it fails to reach any of his teammates as the opposition's defence averts the threat. West Brom force their opponents to concede a corner.
Craig Dawson (West Brom) delivers a lovely cross into the penalty area. Nevertheless, an opposition defender is alert and averts the danger with a brilliant clearance.

James McClean (West Brom) attempts to send a low pass into the box from the edge of the penalty area, but the opposition's defence knocks the ball to safety. The linesman signals a throw in for West Brom.
West Brom enjoy a period of possession as they are exchanging some passes and waiting for an opportunity to strike.

annotations.label: attendance
annotations.description: The attendance is 40945.
Willian (Chelsea) takes a short free kick. Kurt Zouma (Chelsea) unleashes a shot from 27 metres out but is unable to find the target and it goes high over the crossbar.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: The game has come to an end for Cesc Fabregas. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Nemanja Matic (Chelsea).
Anthony Taylor blows his whistle and signals a foul after Gareth McAuley (West Brom) brought his opponent down. A free kick has been awarded to Chelsea.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) zig zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a superb stop.

annotations.label: soccer-ball-own
annotations.description: Own goal! Gareth McAuley (West Brom) suffers a good deal of misfortune as he accidentally puts a pass from one of the attacking players into his own net. The score is 1:1.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Craig Gardner (West Brom) takes the corner which is cleared by the opposition's defence.
Saido Berahino (West Brom) breaks into the penalty area but his shot is blocked. The referee signals a corner kick to West Brom.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: James McClean (West Brom) is booked by the referee.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Thibaut Courtois (Chelsea) is yellow carded.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: The yellow card goes to Glyn Oliver Myhill (West Brom). This is an obvious ploy to delay the restart of play from Glyn Oliver Myhill (West Brom).

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jose Rondon trots off the pitch and is replaced by Stephane Sessegnon (West Brom).
is penalised for a foul. Anthony Taylor had a clear view and blows his whistle.
Saido Berahino (West Brom) gets in a good position to shoot just outside the box after a nice pass, but his effort is unintentionally blocked by one of his teammate.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The corner from Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) is hurriedly cleared.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) has a shot blocked from inside the box. Good work from Chelsea as they win a corner.
Willian (Chelsea) attempts to find his teammate with a pass from outside the box, but the opposition's defence is quick to react and thwarts the attack.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Chelsea work the corner short. The ball is passed to a nearby teammate.
The ball is cleared after Diego Costa (Chelsea) attempted to dribble past an opposing player. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Chelsea.

annotations.label: funfact
annotations.description: The ratio of the ball possession is 62:38. The shots on goal statistics – 2:6.
Chelsea showcase their great team work by exchanging one two passes, but one wayward pass sees them lose possession.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Substitution. Claudio Yacob walks off the pitch and Saido Berahino (West Brom) comes on as a substitute.
Willian (Chelsea) fires in an effort from the free kick from some 20 metres. His strike is very inaccurate and ends in row Z.
A player from West Brom takes his opponent down, the referee blows his whistle for a foul. Chelsea are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
has a good chance to score with a mid range attempt after collecting a pass. He aims for the bottom left corner, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Glyn Oliver Myhill (West Brom).
Jonny Evans (West Brom) attempts a long crossfield pass, but the defence does well to intercept the ball.
The foul by Diego Costa (Chelsea) was seen by Anthony Taylor who didn't hesitate to blow the whistle.
Some neat passing and movement from Chelsea as they ping around some short passes in order to create a new attacking opportunity.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The ball is whipped in from the corner by Chris Brunt (West Brom), but one of the defenders gets it clear.

Jose Rondon (West Brom) strikes a promising volley towards goal, but one of the defenders is quick enough to step in and make a crucial block. West Brom have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Diego Costa (Chelsea) has tested the patience of referee Anthony Taylor and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Oscar (Chelsea) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper blocks the effort.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Willian (Chelsea) is heading toward the corner flag to take the set piece.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The corner from Willian (Chelsea) is intercepted by the defence. The ball goes out of play and Chelsea have been awarded a corner kick.
Branislav Ivanovic (Chelsea) produces a lovely ball into the penalty area but the defender manages to intercept and comfortably averts the danger. Corner kick. Chelsea will have an opportunity.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Guus Hiddink makes a switch. Kenedy (Chelsea) is coming on in place of Pedro at the start of the second period.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The players are back out on the pitch following the half time break and the second half is about to start.

The fans must be pleased so far with the entertainment on the pitch. Let's hope the players don't lose their passion and determination during the half time break. Neither side is enjoying any significant control of the game. The home players have grown in confidence and started to string some passes together. The visiting side have relied on their defence and counter attacks.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The match has reached half time.
Craig Gardner (West Brom) whips the ball in from the long range free kick, but the first man gets it clear.
John Obi Mikel (Chelsea) is penalised for holding. Anthony Taylor signals a set piece. West Brom win a free kick and will be able to apply some pressure on the opposition goal.
Craig Dawson (West Brom) skips past his man but can't keep the ball in play.

annotations.label: time
annotations.description: We will have 3 min. of added time.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) tries to create a chance, but puts too much weight on his pass. The ball goes out of play and West Brom will have a goal kick.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Willian (Chelsea) launches an inaccurate corner kick into the penalty area.
Branislav Ivanovic (Chelsea) looks to break free, but an opposing player clears the ball away. The linesman points to the corner flag, Chelsea are going to take it.

Jose Rondon (West Brom) knew what to do with the ball, but was just a bit unlucky. After receiving a pass, he sent the ball goalwards from some 19 metres out, but he missed the right post by a whisker.
Chris Brunt (West Brom) dinks a cross into the box in an attempt to find one of his teammates, but the defence manages to clear.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The ball goes out of play. Chelsea are awarded a corner kick. The resulting corner from Willian (Chelsea) comes to nothing.

Claudio Yacob (West Brom) is obviously not following the Golden Rule: „Treat others as you want to be treated.“ He makes a bad challenge and leaves Anthony Taylor with no other option than to blow for a foul.
Chelsea seem to be finding their feet as they enjoy some possession. They are waiting for the right moment to create new attacking opportunities.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: What a hit that is! Craig Gardner (West Brom) scores a great goal from approximately 22 metres out. His effort goes straight into the bottom left corner and he makes it 1:1.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and immediately unleashes a shot towards goal, but it goes high over the crossbar.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) latches on to a pin point through ball, but one of the defending players dispossess him. Brilliant defending.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) is forced to stop his attacking move after the linesman signals for offside.
Oscar (Chelsea) looks to break free, but his touch lets him down and he loses the ball.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Willian (Chelsea) takes the corner and sends it into the penalty area, but the opposition's defence is ready and makes a good clearance.
Pedro (Chelsea) races towards goal but the defender gets back well to make a challenge. It will be a corner kick for Chelsea.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) nearly creates a chance, but his attempt to pick out a teammate with a through ball does not come off. The ball has crossed the sideline. Chelsea are taking a throw in.
Willian (Chelsea) sends a pass into the box, but his attempt is thwarted and cleared.
Chelsea are playing some nice combination football, sending it precisely from player to player, but a defender shows good anticipation and ends the move with a good block.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: The foul by Claudio Yacob (West Brom) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Anthony Taylor.
The free kick is taken by Claudio Yacob (West Brom), but ball is cleared.
John Obi Mikel (Chelsea) commits an ugly challenge. The referee sees it and immediately blows his whistle. West Brom win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Oscar (Chelsea) makes a yard for himself on the edge of the box and produces a poor effort that sails miles wide of the right post.
Chelsea keep possession of the ball by producing short passes and one two passes from player to player.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: It's a goal! Branislav Ivanovic plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 1:0.
Chelsea are seeing far more of the ball now.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Diego Costa, but he can't get on the end of the pass.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Chris Brunt (West Brom) launches a powerful cross from the corner into the box, but the ball is intercepted by the defender.

Craig Dawson (West Brom) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the bottom right corner. The effort, however, is blocked by Thibaut Courtois, who pulls off a stunning save! The referee blows his whistle, West Brom are awarded a corner kick.

Craig Gardner (West Brom) makes a yard for himself on the edge of the box after picking up a pass, but produces a poor effort that sails high over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Chelsea.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Chris Brunt (West Brom) takes the corner but fails to find any of his teammates. The ball is easily cleared out of danger.

Darren Fletcher (West Brom) connects with a precise cross inside the goalmouth and shoots. One of the defending players reacts in time and clears the ball to safety. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. West Brom will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
James McClean (West Brom) sends the ball into the box from the side of the pitch, but his cross is blocked.

Gareth McAuley (West Brom) tackles a bit over zealously and Anthony Taylor blows for a foul. Chelsea are given an advantage. They have a free kick. Chelsea try to maintain the tempo of the game by taking a quick free kick.
Darren Fletcher (West Brom) sends over a free kick from long range but the defence is alert.
One of the Chelsea players tripped an opponent and conceded a foul. It's a free kick to West Brom in a dangerous position.
Willian (Chelsea) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Problems for Tony Pulis as James Morrison is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Craig Gardner (West Brom) replaces him.

annotations.label: injury
annotations.description: James Morrison (West Brom) picks up an injury.
The Chelsea players keep the ball and are exchanging a combination of passes. They are waiting for gaps in the defence to open up.
James McClean (West Brom) meets a cross from Darren Fletcher, but he cannot keep his header on target. It goes high over the crossbar.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) sends a pass into the box, but the opposition's defence is alert to the danger and makes a clearance.
CLOSE! Diego Costa (Chelsea) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that whistles over the bar.
The players are on the pitch and West Brom will have the kick off.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The first half has started.
Anthony Taylor will referee today's match.

annotations.label: lineup1
annotations.description: The starting lineups for this match have been revealed.
Welcome to our minute by minute commentary of today's clash. You can enjoy a written form of everything important that will be happening on the pitch. Have fun.

It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has been more to see on the pitch than in most of the other games. Neither of the teams had any obvious superiority in this game. The strategy of the home side was to control the pace of the match with possession style football. Whereas the strategy of the away side was a bit risky and reliant on solid defending to dispossess the opponent and break fast.
